ID.title: Media Session ID
ID.description: This identifies an instance of a content stream unique to an individual playback.

name.title: Series ID
name.description: Content ID of the content, which can be used to tie back to other industry / CMS IDs.

friendlyName.title: Content Name
friendlyName.description: This is the “friendly” (human-readable) name of the content.

length.title: Media Content Length
length.description: Clip Length/Runtime - This is the maximum length (or duration) of the content being consumed (in seconds).

contentType.title: Broadcast Content Type
contentType.description: The type of the stream delivery. Available values per Stream Type: Audio: “song”, “podcast”, “audiobook”, “radio”;  Video: “VoD”, “Live”, “Linear”, “UGC”, “DVoD”. Customers can provide custom values for this parameter.

channel.title: Content Channel
channel.description: Distribution channel from where the content was played.

appVersion.title: Version
appVersion.description: The SDK version used by the player. This could have any custom value that makes sense for your player.

show.title: Series Name
show.description: Program/Series Name. Program Name is required only if the show is part of a series.

season.title: Season Number
season.description: The season number the show belongs to. Season Series is required only if the show is part of a series.

assetID.title: Asset ID
assetID.description: This is the unique identifier for the content of the media asset, such as the TV series episode identifier, movie asset identifier, or live event identifier. Typically these IDs are derived from metadata authorities such as EIDR, TMS/Gracenote, or Rovi. These identifiers can also be from other proprietary or in-house systems.

genre.title: Genre
genre.description: Type or grouping of content as defined by content producer. Values should be comma delimited in variable implementation.

firstAirDate.title: First Air Date
firstAirDate.description: The date when the content first aired on television. Any date format is acceptable, but Adobe recommends: YYYY-MM-DD.

firstDigitalDate.title: First Digital Date
firstDigitalDate.description: The date when the content first aired on any digital channel or platform. Any date format is acceptable but Adobe recommends: YYYY-MM-DD.

rating.title: Rating Value
rating.description: Rating as defined by TV Parental Guidelines.

showType.title: Show Type
showType.description: The type of content for example, trailer or full episode.

adLoad.title: Ad Load Type
adLoad.description: The type of ad loaded as defined by each customer's internal representation.

isAuthenticated.title: Media Authorized
isAuthenticated.description: The user has been authorized via Adobe authentication.

dayPart.title: Day Part
dayPart.description: A property that defines the time of the day when the content was broadcast or played. This could have any value set as necessary by customers.

feed.title: Feed Type
feed.description: The type of feed, which can either represent actual feed-related data such as  EAST HD or SD, or the source of the feed like a URL.

hasResume.title: Resume
hasResume.description: Marks each playback that was resumed after more than 30 minutes of buffer, pause, or stall period.

streamType.title: Stream Type
streamType.description: The type of the media stream.

artist.title: Artist
artist.description: The name of the album artist or group performing the music recording or video.

album.title: Album
album.description: The name of the album that the music recording or video belongs to.

station.title: Radio Station
station.description: The radio station name on which the audio is played.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: Name of the audio content publisher.

segment.title: Video Segment
segment.description: The interval that describes the part of the content that has been viewed in minutes.

isDownloaded.title: Media Downloaded Flag
isDownloaded.description: The stream was played locally on the device after being downloaded.

isFederated.title: Federated Data
isFederated.description: Set to true when the hit is federated (i.e., received by the customer as part of a federated data share, rather than their own implementation).

isViewed.title: Media Starts
isViewed.description: Load event for the media. (This occurs when the viewer clicks the Play button). This would count even if there are pre-roll ads, buffering, errors, and so on.

isPlayed.title: Content Starts
isPlayed.description: First frame of media is consumed. If the user drops during ad, buffering, etc., then there would be no “Content Start” event.

isCompleted.title: Content Completes
isCompleted.description: Indicates if a timed media asset was watched to completion, this does not necessarily mean the viewer watched the whole video; viewer could have skipped ahead.

timePlayed.title: Content Time Spent
timePlayed.description: Sums the event duration (in seconds) for all events of type PLAY on the main content.

totalTimePlayed.title: Media Time Spent
totalTimePlayed.description: Describes the total amount of time spent by a user on a specific timed media asset, which includes time spent watching ads.

uniqueTimePlayed.title: Unique Time Played
uniqueTimePlayed.description: Describes the sum of the unique intervals seen by a user on a timed media asset - i.e. the length playback intervals viewed multiple times are only counted once.

averageMinuteAudience.title: Average Minute Audience
averageMinuteAudience.description: Describes the average content time spent for a specific media item - i.e. the total content time spent divided by the length for all of the playback sessions.

adCount.title: Ad Count
adCount.description: The number of ads started during the playback.

chapterCount.title: Chapter Count
chapterCount.description: The number of chapters started during the playback.

hasProgress10.title: 10% Progress Marker
hasProgress10.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 10% marker of media based on stream length. The marker is only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

hasProgress25.title: 25% Progress Marker
hasProgress25.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 25% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

hasProgress50.title: 50% Progress Marker
hasProgress50.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 50% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

hasProgress75.title: 75% Progress Marker
hasProgress75.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 75% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

hasProgress95.title: 95% Progress Marker
hasProgress95.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 95% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

estimatedStreams.title: Estimated Streams
estimatedStreams.description: The estimated number of video or audio streams per each individual content.

hasPauseImpactedStreams.title: Pause Impacted Streams
hasPauseImpactedStreams.description: Indicates if one or more pauses occurred during the playback of a single media item.

pauseCount.title: Pause Events
pauseCount.description: The number of pause periods that occurred during playback.

pauseTime.title: Total Pause Duration
pauseTime.description: Describes the duration in seconds in which playback was paused by the user.

hasSegmentView.title: Media Segment Views
hasSegmentView.description: Indicates when at least one frame, not necessarily the first has been viewed.

secondsSinceLastCall.title: Media Session Server Timeout
secondsSinceLastCall.description: Indicates the amount of time, in seconds, that passed between the user's last known interaction and the moment the session was closed.
